entities.name: firenze
entities.description: Firenze is mentioned as a centaur who used to be the Divination teacher, but now he's staying. He's not being taken back by other centaurs.

entities.name: trelawney
entities.description: Trelawney is mentioned as a person who will be teaching, alongside Firenze. She's also the subject of Ron's criticism for being useless.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as someone who might have wanted to get rid of Trelawney, but couldn't.

entities.name: ginny
entities.description: Ginny is mentioned as a person who says that Firenze and Trelawney will both be teaching.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as someone who criticizes Divination, saying it's useless, and also expresses his dislike for Trelawney.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as someone who defends Divination, saying that the whole subject isn't useless after all.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as someone who's keeping a secret about a prophecy and is worried about how others will react when they find out.

entities.name: neville
entities.description: Neville is mentioned as someone who told Harry, Ron, and Hermione that the prophecy had smashed while Harry was pulling him up the steps in the Death Room.

relationships.description: Firenze and Trelawney will both be teaching, as mentioned by Ginny.
Dumbledore might have wanted to get rid of Trelawney, but couldn't, as mentioned by Ron.
Ron criticizes Divination and specifically mentions that Trelawney is not good at it.
